content: Who was the author of "The Great Gatsby", a novel about wealth and love set in the Roaring Twenties?

The author of "The Great Gatsby" is F. Scott Fitzgerald. The novel was published in 1925 and is considered one of the greatest works of American literature. It explores themes of wealth, love, ambition, and the American Dream through the characters of Jay Gatsby, Daisy Buchanan, and Nick Carraway, among others. The story is set against the backdrop of the Roaring Twenties, a period of economic prosperity and cultural change in the United States.
